alert.note: Alert for Greene; Montgomery; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 4:29PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN WARREN, SOUTHWESTERN GREENE AND SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM EDT... At 429 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Springboro, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Kettering, Beavercreek, Miamisburg, Lebanon, Springboro, Franklin, Bellbrook, Moraine, West Carrollton, Waynesville, Hunter, Centerville, Lytle, Pekin, State Route 48 at State Route 73, Genntown and Woodbourne-Hyde Park. This includes I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 39 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
